item.title: Dan Rather's Moon Moves Behind a Cloud
item.description: Not sure whether to wind a watch or bark at the moon, Dan Rather announced his resignation after 24 years as CBS anchor. With his credibility as thin as turnip soup, his legacy shakier than cafeteria Jell-O, and his fingernails...

item.title: Bill Clinton Humor Tribute
item.description: In honor of the opening of the Clinton Presidential Library, we offer a comic tribute to the Clinton years and the golden age of political comedy. View our titillating collection of Clinton cartoons and parodies, as well as editorial...

item.title: Condi Rice's Secret Ambition
item.description: With Secretary of State Colin Powell headed for the door, it's not surprising that President Bush has tapped Condoleezza Rice as his replacement. After all, Bush and Rice enjoy an unusually close relationship. That became apparent earlier this year...

item.title: Red vs. Blue
item.description: The election may be over, but the divisions between red and blue America are growing wider and wackier. Check out a series of amusing red vs. blue parodies making the rounds, including maps showing a new United States of Canada,...

item.title: Let the Eagle Soar
item.description: With Attorney General John Ashcroft resigning, we offer a comic tribute to a man who spent the last four years shielding us from the dangers of imminent terror, naked statues, and our constitutional freedoms. Check out cartoons and late-night jokes...

item.title: Oh Canada
item.description: It didn't take long after the presidential election results came in before would-be refugees from the blue states began flocking to Canada's immigration Web site. Some jokesters, however, have come up with a better plan. According to one parody...

item.title: Election Night Ratherisms
item.description: CBS Anchor Dan Rather was once again in fine form on election night. Just in case there was any lingering doubt that he is insane, we offer this recap of his rhetorical flourishes: "Do you hear that knocking...President Bush's re-election...

item.title: Voting Irregularities
item.description: In the latest example of life imitating satire, people around the country reported irregularities with electronic voting machines that registered votes for Bush when they were trying to cast ballots for Kerry. Their experience bore an eerie similarity this Florida...

item.title: The Best Humor of Campaign 2004
item.description: From JibJab's political cartoons to Will Ferrell's Bush shtick to election satire from "The Daily Show" and "The Onion," check out the best political humor of campaign 2004....

item.title: Electoral Dysfunction
item.description: As America teeters on the edge of another close election and another potential fiasco, it seems a fitting time to revisit the great humor that emerged during the 2000 Florida recount. That's when hanging chads and butterfly ballots spawned...

item.title: Ridge Resigns, Citing Desire to Spend More Time Scaring His Family
item.description: With Homeland Security Secretary Tom Ridge announcing his resignation, we offer a comic tribute to his fun- and fear-filled tenure. Check out parodies of Ridge's oft-ridiculed color-coded alert system and the government's terrorism preparedness guide, plus view cartoons mocking...
